subject: Art & Design
title: Jakob's Law: Users Prefer Familiar Patterns
description: A quick, practical guide to Jakob's Law: Users Prefer Familiar Patterns.

hook.text: Users spend most of their time on OTHER sites. They expect your site to work like those.

buildup.text: Jakob's Law: users transfer expectations from one product to another. Familiarity reduces learning effort.

discovery.text: E-commerce sites put the cart top-right. Search bars sit top-center. Logos link to home. These are learned conventions.

twist.text: Innovation vs. convention is a constant tension. Too innovative = confusing. Too conventional = forgettable.

climax.text: Snapchat initially confused older users by ignoring conventions.

punchline.text: Don't make users learn your interface.

quiz.question: What does Jakob's Law suggest about website design?
options: Users expect your site to work like other sites they already use
Every website should look completely unique
Users prefer sites with the most features
